# Grids & Spacing

You can see a wide spectrum of Grids & Spacing guidelines helping in your design projects ðŸ‘‡

<div style={{ display: "flex" }}>
  <img style={{ width: "220px", height: "134px", }} src={padding} alt="padding" />

  <div style={{ display: "flex", flexDirection: "column", marginTop: "15px", fontSize: "14px",}}>
    <b>Padding</b>
    <br/>
    <div style={{fontSize: "inherit",}}>
      The CSS padding properties are used to generate space around an element's
      content,
      <br /> inside of any defined borders. In here, we use it like a margin generator.
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

<div style={{ display: "flex", marginTop: "27px", }}>
  <img style={{ width: "192px", height: "138px", }} src={columnsFixed} alt="columnsFixed" />

  <div style={{ display: "flex", flexDirection: "column", margin: "15px 0 0 28px", fontSize: "14px",}}>
    <b>Column grids / Fixed</b>
    <br/>
    <div style={{fontSize: "inherit",}}>
      When you resize your frame, the column width remains the same (Does not scale) and the set of 
      columns stays at the center of the frame all the time.
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

<div style={{ display: "flex", margin: "27px 0 64px 0", }}>
  <img style={{ width: "162px", height: "122px", }} src={columnsFluid} alt="columnsFluid" />

  <div style={{
      display: "flex",
      flexDirection: "column",
      margin: "15px 0 0 58px",
      fontSize: "14px",
    }}
  >
    <b>Column grids / Fluid</b>
    <br />
    <div style={{ fontSize: "inherit" }}>
        When you resize your frame, the columns scale to keep-up the same Margin.
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

ðŸ“’ Note

1.  You can always apply grids to a Frame, and not groups or rectangles.
